name: ProgramName
definition: contextual designation for a program within the context in which that program is administered
label: programme name

name: ProjectIdentifier
definition: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific project within the context in which that project or an overarching program is administered
label: project identifier

name: SalesStrategy
label: sales strategy
definition: strategy for selling something, including allocating resources to the sales process, reducing costs, and optimizing revenues

name: BusinessStrategy
definition: strategy for achieving a specific business goal, objective, solution or outcome
label: business strategy

name: Project
definition: state of affairs and unique and temporary organization, designed to deliver a tangible output
label: project
explanatoryNote: A project has a fixed - generally fairly short - timeframe, and a project manager is responsible for delivering the output on time and on budget.

name: Strategy
explanatoryNote: A strategy may involve activities that are needed in order to achieve specific goals or objectives. It may take into account one or more policies or any number of restrictions and constraints.
definition: plan or method for achieving a specific goal, objective, solution or outcome
label: strategy

name: Program
definition: state of affairs and coordinated set of activities designed to obtain benefits not available from managing them individually
label: program

name: Objective
definition: short-term, quantitative, measurable result that a party seeks to attain in order to achieve its long-term goals
label: objective

name: DistributionStrategy
label: distribution strategy
definition: strategy for making a product or service available, or for distributing funds, such as in the form of a dividend or coupon

name: ProgramIdentifier
label: programme identifier
definition: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific program within the context in which that program is administered

name: BusinessObjective
definition: objective that reflects the strategic goals and direction of a business within a time frame and available resources
label: business objective
explanatoryNote: In general, objectives are more specific and easier to measure than goals. Objectives are basic tools that underlie all planning and strategic activities. They serve as the basis for creating policy and evaluating performance. Some examples of business objectives include minimizing expenses, expanding internationally, or making a profit.

name: FinancialObjective
label: financial objective
definition: objective that reflects the strategic financial goals and direction of a party within a time frame and available resources

name: InvestmentObjective
definition: financial objective used by an investor to determine whether or not a given potential investment is appropriate for themselves or on behalf of another party
label: investment objective
explanatoryNote: The combination of investment objectives and risk tolerance are typically used to identify appropriate investment options.

name: hasStrategy
definition: relates something to a plan or method for achieving a specific goal, objective, solution or outcome
label: has strategy

name: Goal
definition: desired result that a party envisions, plans, and to which it commits, in order to achieve a desired state
explanatoryNote: Many people endeavor to reach goals within a finite time by setting deadlines.
label: goal

name: hasGoal
label: has goal
definition: relates something to a long-term, desired outcome

name: hasObjective
definition: relates something to a specific objective (result) that it aims to achieve within a time frame and with available resources
label: has objective
